column1: 007 - The World Is Not Enough (USA)>007 - The World Is Not Enough>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Electronic Arts>Black Ops Entertainment>Shooter>3.2>1 Player>007: The World is Not Enough is based off of the 1999 James Bond film of the same name. In it
column2: Pierce Brosnan's Bond must investigate the murder of a British oil tycoon and attacks on his new pipeline
column3: which leads to a larger sinister plot requiring gunplay and frequent flier miles to diffuse.  This version of the game has a few notable differences to its Nintendo 64 counterpart: it runs off a version of the Medal of Honor engine
column4: and has 11 missions in contrast to the N64's 14; some of which are not shared between the two. The missions that are similar (usually those taken from the film) further tend to play out differently
column5: and utilize completely different gadgets and weaponry. This version does not feature additional objectives at higher difficulty modes
column6: and only cheats are unlocked by beating specific missions at a specific difficulty. However
column7: it does feature CD-quality music and voices
column8: as well as video clips from the movie for cutscenes. It is single-player only
column9: and features no multiplayer component.

column1: 007 - Tomorrow Never Dies (USA)>007 - Tomorrow Never Dies>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Electronic Arts>Black Ops Entertainment>Shooter>3.4>1 Player>In 007: Tomorrow Never Dies
column2: which is based on the movie of the same name
column3: the player takes the role of the famous James Bond who fights against Elliot Carver. Carver tries to increase his TV ratings by creating a war between the British and the Chinese. To achieve his goal he sunk a British ship with his stealth ship and made it look like the Chinese Air Force was the offender. Now it is Bond's responsibility to set things right...  Most of the ten levels are like traditional third-person-shooters where the player walks around the levels while killing numerous foes. While there is an option for a free aim most enemies can be dispatched with the auto-lock function. This means if the player gets close enough to an enemy while using an appropriate gun the game automatically shoots at him when the player faces the general direction. Bond also has gadgets to his disposal which are used to fulfill the mission goals. There are two missions which differ from this formula: in the driving sequence the player chases and shoots at enemy cars while avoiding obstacles; during the skiing part he is mainly concerned with dispatching other skiers which want to bring him out of balance.

column1: Amerzone - The Explorer's Legacy (Europe) (Disc 1)>Amerzone - The Explorer's Legacy – Disc 1>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Microids>Microids>Adventure>3.5>1 Player>In 1932
column2: Alexandre Valembois was a young explorer who
column3: with his native friend Anonio Alverez
column4: wanted to make a name for himself by exploring the mysterious Amerzone region. Befriended by the natives of the region
column5: he witnessed a strange ritual involving a giant egg of the famed white birds. Wanting to prove that the white birds existed
column6: Alexandre stole the mysterious egg and betrayed the natives' trust Returning to France
column7: nobody believed Alexandre or his journals about the Amerzone. Sixty years have passed and the world has changed. World War 2 has come and gone
column8: the Amerzone remains unexplored and closed off to outsiders by it's despotic leader
column9: Anoino Alverez. Monsieur Alexandre Valembois is an old man at the end of his life
column10: living alone in a lighthouse and wishing to fix his mistake. At this time
column11: a young reporter comes to visit the old Alexandre Valembois regarding his adventures...  Amerzone is a first person adventure game
column12: similar to Myst
column13: taking place between different rooms and areas. The player assumes the role of the reporter and must unravel the clues left by Monsieur Valembois
column14: travelling over several picturesque locations and eventually reaching the fictional Amerzone region. The adventure game takes place over a series of areas. The player can click on arrow icons to change the orientation or to move to different areas. Objects of interest change the cursor to a magnifying glass icon. Objects that can be interacted with or picked up change the cursor to a hand icon. An icon of gears represents a mechanism which must be manipulated before it can be properly used. The player's inventory can be accessed at any time.

column1: Battle Arena Toshinden (USA)>Battle Arena Toshinden>1995>ESRB - T (Teen)>SCEA>Takara.>Fighter>3.6>1-2 Players>In Battle Arena Toshinden eight world renown weapon fighters have been invited to a mysterious tournament. column2: Toshinden's game play can be considered similar to Street Fighter
column3: but in 3d and with a little less depth to the moves.****Two versions of Toshinden were released; for the Sony PlayStation and later a lesser known version for DOS PC's. However the PC version is not a straight port of the PlayStation version and plays and looks notably different despite sharing the same characters
column4: attacks and controls.****The U.S and E.U Playstation versions of Toshinden feature redone voices in English and redone music using different instruments. ****The lyrics on Sofia's stage music in the Japanese version
column5: which were actually in English
column6: were removed in the process
column7: likely due to their suggestive nature. ****Sofia's and Ellis' voices in the English translation are also notably adjusted

column1: Battle Arena Toshinden 2 (USA)>Battle Arena Toshinden 2>1996>ESRB - T (Teen)>Playmates>Takara.>Fighter>3.2>1-2 Players>Battle Arena Toshinden 2 is the first sequel to Battle Arena Toshinden.****It adds three new starting fighters; Tracy and Chaos with the original game's final boss
column2: Gaia returning un-armoured and with a completely new move set. There are also three new bosses and hidden characters raising the total number of fighters to 15 (up from 10).****Toshinden 2
column3: on top of additional special attacks for every character
column4: adds several running attacks to each character: the ability to strike a grounded opponent with new ground attacks and the powerful Overdrive attacks that one must fill up a bar by using other attacks to be able to use.****Toshinden 2 also does away with the free-form combo system of the original Toshinden replacing it with a simple combo system (i.e. light attack
column5: hard attack
column6: special or light attack
column7: light attack
column8: hard attack
column9: special). The 3D movement in Toshinden 2 has also been made notably slower to prevent the heavy abuse it could be used for in the original.****As a result
column10: while the core game play is similar
column11: this sequel is more tactical than the original game. Where as in the original Toshinden
column12: one could throw normal attacks (i.e. light slashes) around with fairly reckless abandon and sidestep repeatedly without fear of their opponent being able to counter them easily
column13: opponents in Toshinden 2 are able to capitalize on individual missed attacks.****As a result
column14: Toshinden 2 is more balanced than its predecessor. This balance was further tweaked with a re-release called "Toshinden 2 plus" in Japan.****Unlike the Playstation release of the original Toshinden
column15: Toshinden 2 was not re-dubbed for releases outside of Japan.****Also unlike the original Toshinden
column16: the PC release of Toshinden 2 for Windows computers
column17: is a straight port of the Playstation version and supports Direct3D rather than specific 3D cards.

column1: Battle Arena Toshinden 3 (USA) (En
column2: Ja)>Battle Arena Toshinden 3>1997>ESRB - T (Teen)>Playmates>Takara.>Fighter>2.9>1-2 Players>The third instalment of the Toshinden series.****After the defeat of the Secret Society in Battle Arena Toshinden 2 a new group of bad guys emerges. Known as the Organization
column3: they wish to use the Toshinden fighters as blood sacrifices for a ritual to summon their dark god.****The number of fighters has been raised from Toshinden 2's 15 characters to a notably larger 32; 14 starting fighters
column4: 14 Organization counterparts and 4 bosses. Though many of the Organization counterparts have near identical move lists to their equivalent starting character.****Toshinden 3's game play is a radical departure from previous games in the series.****The arenas have been redesigned so that they are now enclosed allowing the ability to send the opponent flying into a wall or the ceiling
column5: though the opponent can recover and use the wall for a counter attack.****The combo system has been redesigned again; now each character has a preset range of combo's
column6: however multiple combo's and special moves can now be combined to juggle the opponent for multiple hits
column7: though once again the opponent can recover and counter your combo.****The games physics have been greatly relaxed to accommodate the new arenas and game play; many attacks launch the opponent clean across the arena.****The U.S and E.U versions of Toshinden 3 feature a slightly different blocking set up to the Japanese version. In the Japanese version there are separate high and low blocks
column8: whereas in the U.S and E.U version the high block has been altered to be an all purpose block and will block both high and low automatically. This small change has a notable impact on the game plays .****The U.S and E.U versions of Toshinden 3 also feature new English voices for several characters and a couple of new game play modes; a comprehensive practice mode and a Survival mode.

column1: Battle Arena Toshinden 4 (Europe)>Battle Arena Toshinden 4>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Virgin Interactive>Takara.>Fighter>3.6>1-2 Players>"The fourth game in the main Toshinden series.  Toshinden 4 attempts to return to the series roots after Toshinden 3's radical departure. As a result Toshinden 4 was ""old school"" for its time.  While Toshinden 4 models it's game play more off Toshinden 1 and Toshinden 2 than 3
column2: it makes what is perhaps the biggest change in the series; it does away with nearly all of the 40+ characters that the series has built up and replaces them with 13 almost completely new characters; only 3 of Toshinden 4's cast have appeared in previous games.  But even they are notably different as Toshinden 4 takes place sometime after Toshinden 3 story wise
column3: hence they have aged. The new cast has some pretty big links to the old cast however and many of their stories and bio's reference the old cast even though most aren't named directly (for instance Lancelot was sent to a certain French noble man to be toughened up
column4: while Fen met a certain spear wielding warrior that his own fighting style is conveniently similar to).  Graphically
column5: Toshinden 4 sacrifices detail for fluid animation and speed
column6: to the point where the original Toshinden arguably looks better overall.  The combo system is once again redone; now the player can make a combo out of any combination of light and hard attacks (high
column7: low and jumping) with the limits that they can only enter each attack once (i.e only one high light slash
column8: one low hard kick etc) and once a hard attack has been inputted
column9: no further light attacks can be entered into the combo. Special attacks have also become more special
column10: generally being considerably more dramatic and requiring more complex button combinations that the past games.  Toshinden 4 also tweaks the series overdrive attacks; now each character has at least two and the bar is split into three segments; one block is used per overdrive attack
column11: though all three can be saved up to activate the new Kishin Kourin attack which bestows a considerable ability increase at the cost of health.  A simple parrying system has been added to Toshinden 4; the player can attempt to repel any weapon based attack or they can use a special counter attack that can counter almost anything
column12: but uses up an overdrive block.  Toshinden 4 introduces multiple arena types to the series; for the first time there are arenas with no edges as well as the standard square and round arenas one can be knocked off for a ring out. Toshinden 4 also introduces a third type of arena to the series; collapsing arenas. As the match goes on holes randomly form in the arena (though warning is given as to where they are about to form). As if to compensate for this new arena type
column13: it is no longer possible to fall off an edge of the ring unless you are hit off or accidently perform a move that takes you over the edge.  As well as the standard fighting aspect
column14: Toshinden 4 also has seven time unlocked themed ""mini games""
column15: that include breakout
column16: air hockey and a dancing game.  There is also a comprehensive database mode to unlock that includes detailed information about every character
column17: sound bites
column18: a jute box and character design sketches including some rejected costumes.  As well as all these extras
column19: Toshinden 4 has pretty much every fighting game mode out there."

column1: Bob the Builder - Can We Fix It (USA)>Bob the Builder - Can We Fix It>2001>ESRB - E (Everyone)>THQ>Steel Monkeys.>Miscellaneous>3.2>1 Player>A game inspired by the children's television program. Can We Build It? activities include: •Knock it down involves helping Lofty knock down an old bridge. Players swing a wrecking ball at a dilapidated bridge. •Build it up involves helping Lofty build a bridge one section at a time. Players control Lofty's hook and use it to pick up sections of a bridge off the ground and place them together so they form a bridge. •Where's Pilchard? has the player helping Wendy find where Pilchard is hiding. Players have to place a food bowl on top of the hiding Pilchard. Travis' Race Day activities include: •The two activities Race with Scoop and Race with Dizzy involves the player playing as either Scoop or Dizzy and has them racing Travis in an overhead racing game to prove who is the fastest. Bubble Trouble activities include: •Bubble Trouble involves helping Roley pop all the bubbles. Players control Roley and have to make him roll over bubbles in a limited amount of time. •Where's Pilchard? plays the same here
column2: except it now takes place in a different location. Porcupine Rescue activities include: •Tunnel Time involves helping porcupines cross a road by having Lofty build a tunnel under the road. Players use Lofty's hook to pick up sections of a tunnel and place them in the correct spot of an outline. •Where's Pilchard? also plays the same here
column3: except it now takes place in another different location. Scary Spud activities include: •Scary Spud involves helping Spud scare away hungry crows from eating all of the seeds. Players control Spud and make him scare the crows off the field in a limited amount of time by making him run at them. •Where's Pilchard? also plays the same here
column4: except it now takes place in another different location. Plumbing Puzzle activities include: •Radiator riddle involves fixing the central heating. Players control Bob and make him place pieces of the central heating to the correct outlined spots in a house. •Fix the leaks involves helping Bob fix leaks in a pipe. Players control Bob while he walks through a house searching for and fixing all the leaking pipes with his wrench in a limited amount of time. Wendy's Birthday activities include: •Cake-tastic! involves helping Bob decorate a birthday cake for Wendy. Players decorate a cake for Wendy by choosing the type of chocolate chips

column1: Championship Manager Quiz (Europe)>Championship Manager Quiz>2001>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Eidos Interactive>King of the Jungle>Quiz>2.3>1-2 Players>Championship Manager Quiz is the unexpected result of developer Sports Interactive looking to branch out from their successful football management series called
column2: funnily enough
column3: Championship Manager. If you think a quiz game may not be the best use of their skills then think again. This isn't just a collection of thousands of football trivia questions with points scored for each correct answer - that would be too simple. The football fans at Sports Interactive have managed to create a quiz game that not only mixes football knowledge but also the rules and tactics involved in the sport too. The quiz is played out like a real game of football. You see the pitch and two sets of teams and get to pick who you want to play as at the start. The idea is to pick your favourite team as the questions will really probe your love for the club. From the kick-off
column4: you must pass the ball around the field by answering questions correctly. Below the shirt of each player are question categories. Pass the ball to that player and answer the question correctly to keep possession. Of course
column5: answer a question incorrectly and the ball goes to the opposition. Get the ball to a striker
column6: answer the question correctly and you've scored. Whoever gets the most questions correct is irrelevant; the game is decided on who scores the most goals. There are over 11
column7: 000 questions so you shouldn't see many being repeated often - in comparison
column8: last year's Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? game only contained 1
column9: 000! The questions cover a broad range of football knowledge too
column10: from domestic to international
column11: third division to golden boot winners. There are five different modes of play

column13: pub quiz where more than two can play and keepy-uppy where you've got to answer correctly for as long as possible.

column1: Demolition Racer (USA)>Demolition Racer>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Infogrames>Pitbull Syndicate>Driving>3.5>1-2 Players>Demolition Racer is a racing game with a twist.  Rather than a game that just requires you to try and win the race
column2: this game gives you points to destroy the other racers' cars.  The game has many styles of game play so you don't have to play the same style each game.****There are 5 game styles in the Single Race section of the game.  This section does not count towards unlocking cars or tracks.  It is for practice and just plain fun.  The main style is Demolition.****In Demolition
column3: you race against other cars around the track and get points for hitting them
column4: spinning them in circles and knocking them into the wall.  You also get a big bonus for landing on top of a car which will immediately destroy the car.  When you finish the race
column5: your final position is**found by multiplying the points you got from hitting the other cars with the points that you got for the position you finished in.  So if you finish first
column6: but never hit anyone
column7: you won't win the race.****The next style is The Chase.  This style is your normal race game.  You can still take damage and so can the other cars
column8: but you are only trying to win the race.  You don't get any points for hitting the other cars.****Chicken is another style.  It is the same as The Chase except that you drive in the opposite direction as everyone else.  This can slow you down when you run into the cars coming around from the other direction.****The next 2 game styles aren't done on race tracks.  They are done in an arena.  This is a circle area which may have hills in it where you just try to destroy cars.  The first of these is Last Man Standing.  In this style
column9: you try to destroy every car without being destroyed yourself.  You can still win if you**aren't the last car by making a lot of points by hitting other cars.  The scoring is calculated the same as the Demolition style.****The final Single Race style is Suicide.  In this style
column10: you try to destroy yourself before any others are destroyed.  You don't get any points for hitting other cars in this style.****Besides the Single Race
column11: there is also League Racing.  In League racing
column12: you are trying to beat a set of tracks.  There are 4 leagues on tracks and one league in the arena.  In order to beat a track (or arena)
column13: you must place in a certain position.  The first league starts out easy; you can finish in 5th place and still beat the track and go on to the next one.  However
column14: as you go up in difficulty of leagues
column15: you will eventually have to place 1st on every track in the league to beat it.  A league will usually have 5-10 tracks to beat.****After you beat a league
column16: you will unlock cars
column17: tracks and other leagues.  There are 11 tracks
column18: 3 arenas and 8 cars that you can get.  The cars can be customized with colors and logos.  You can also have portraits of the racers on top of the cars.

column1: Descent (USA)>Descent>1996>ESRB - T (Teen)>Interplay>Parallax Software Corporation>Shooter>3.4>1 Player>"The Post-Terran Minerals Corporation (PTMC) digs up minerals on all nine planets of the solar system

column1: EA Sports Supercross 2000 (USA)>EA Sports Supercross 2000>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>EA Sports>Page 44 Studios
column2: LLC>Driving>3.4>1-2 Players>"You throttle your engine

column1: FIFA Soccer 96 (USA)>FIFA Soccer 96>1995>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Electronic Arts>EA Canada>Sports/Soccer>2.8>1-2 Players>Aiming to be the first football simulation that is realistic in the true sense of the word
column2: FIFA Soccer 96 was extremely popular at the time of release. It was hailed as the first really successful FIFA release
column3: and opened the way for yearly revisions of the concept.****There were a number of factors that made FIFA96 stand out from the crowd of other football sims. Firstly
column4: the game's commentary was revolutionary at the time -- the renowned British commentator John Motson comments all the incidents and happenings on the pitch in real-time. The ambient commentary is varied
column5: and systems with more than the minimum memory level get extra commentary phrases.****The Virtual Stadium technology has numerous pre-defined camera angles. The game even has a SVGA mode for better-than-minimum system****FIFA96 boasts eleven leagues from all around the world
column6: ranging from the unknown players of the Malaysian league to the celebrated stars of the English and Italian leagues. 59 International teams are also featured
column7: and it's possible to match the teams you want to against each other through friendlies
column8: or you can also choose to play domestic tournaments or International ones such as the World Cup. If you're not satisfied with the composition of the various teams
column9: you can create your own dream team through the custom team creator.

column1: Final Fantasy Anthology - European Edition - Final Fantasy IV (Europe)>Final Fantasy Anthology - European Edition - Final Fantasy IV>2001>ESRB - T (Teen)>Squaresoft>Squaresoft>Role-Playing>4.2>1 Player>The military country of Baron is one of the strongest in the land
column2: with a proud army and a majestic air force known as the Red Wings. However
column3: the recent actions of the king make even the most loyal of his subordinates doubt his judgment. The captain of the Red Wings
column4: Cecil
column5: is ordered to attack the city of Mysidia and take the Water Crystal from innocent magicians who protect it. When Cecil questions the king's orders
column6: he is immediately thrown out of the country and sent off to deliver a package to the village of Mist
column7: accompanied by his best friend Kain
column8: the captain of the dragoons. Little does he realize that the king's inexplicable behavior is but a part of a much larger picture
column9: which he is yet to reveal.  The fourth entry in the Final Fantasy series was released as Final Fantasy II in the West
column10: because the second and the third games were not released there at the time. The game is a Japanese-style RPG with top-down world map navigation
column11: automatic leveling up
column12: and random enemy encounters.  The game introduces a system called ATB (active-time battle). While combat is turn-based in its core
column13: the game does not pause when the player accesses the battle menu. Enemies continue to act in real time regardless of the actions of the player-controlled party. The turns of the participants are calculated depending on their agility rating. Each player-controlled character has a special bar that gradually refills itself; said character may act when the bar is full.  Unlike all the previous Final Fantasy games
column14: the fourth installment does not allow the player to customize the characters' abilities and classes. Each character belongs to a specific
column15: clearly defined class: dragoon
column16: white mage
column17: black mage
column18: summoner
column19: ninja
column20: etc. Each of these classes has distinct special abilities or magic spells. New abilities are learned automatically when a character reaches a pre-determined level. Characters join and leave the party as dictated by the game's plot events. The active party includes up to five combatants.  The PlayStation version adds a new rendered intro and ending.

column1: Final Fantasy Anthology - European Edition - Final Fantasy V (Europe)>Final Fantasy Anthology - European Edition - Final Fantasy V>1999>ESRB - T (Teen)>Squaresoft>Squaresoft>Role-Playing>4.2>1 Player>The Elemental Crystals are the life source of the planet. With them
column2: gentle winds blow
column3: the seas are active
column4: fire burns bright
column5: and the earth is full of life. All seems well in the world
column6: until the wind suddenly stops
column7: the sea begin to grow stagnant
column8: the heat of fire becomes scarce
column9: and the earth begins to wither. King Tycoon
column10: sensing a premonition of evil
column11: hurries off to check on the Wind Crystal
column12: only to witness it destroy itself.  Meanwhile
column13: a young traveler named Bartz is camping in a field when a giant meteor strikes the planet. When he heads out to examine the meteor
column14: he is shocked to find a young girl named Lenna
column15: who is the princess of Tycoon
column16: and an old man named Galuf
column17: who is on a critical mission. Later
column18: joined by Faris
column19: a pirate captain
column20: the foursome must travel the land in search of the destroyer of the Crystals
column21: and save the planet at any cost.  Final Fantasy V is a role-playing game that uses the Active Time Battle system first introduced in Final Fantasy IV. It also incorporates the Job/Ability system from Final Fantasy III

column1: Final Fantasy Tactics (USA)>Final Fantasy Tactics>1998>ESRB - T (Teen)>SCEA>Squaresoft>Strategy>3.9>1 Player>"Final Fantasy Tactics was a big move for the whole Final Fantasy franchise into different fields. column2: isometric

column1: Grand Slam '97 (USA)>Grand Slam '97>1997>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Virgin Interactive>Burst>Sports/Basketball>3.5>1-2 Players>Grand Slam Baseball was an innovative
column2: albeit relatively low-key release from Virgin Interactive Entertainment in 1997.****Not known for sports games
column3: VIE released Grand Slam for Windows
column4: Sony Playstation and Sega Saturn as the second title in its attempt to establish a mainstream sports line. The first title in the short-lived line was Power Play Hockey in 1996. The sports line would last only one more title after Grand Slam's release
column5: that being the sequel to the hockey game
column6: also released in 1997.****Grand Slam was one of the early adopters of 3D accelerator card technology and also offered full 3D play in software alone. The Playstation and Saturn versions were 3D by default.****Grand Slam introduced a few play mechanics to video game baseball that would later prove to be fixtures in the genre. The most notable in this area was the introduction of a meter for pitching
column7: used to control the velocity and accuracy of pitches
column8: similar to the familiar swing meter in popular golf games. This meter was later borrowed and made popular by titles such as EA's MVP Baseball. On the batting side of things
column9: a similar metered approach was used. This was inspired by older arcade baseball games that allowed the player to load up a swing's power with a control stick before releasing it as the pitch came in.****Other highlights amongst Grand Slam's feature set included:****- A trade AI engine that would examine the needs of a team and decide if a proposed trade was in its best interest.****- Catcher AI and pitch signals
column10: helping a player learn how to pitch to each batter's strengths and weaknesses.****- Attention to details and baseball flavor
column11: such as players that would blow bubble gum bubbles during an at bat
column12: light- hearted commentary
column13: an All Star Break during season play (complete with a working voting ballot)
column14: and an in-game JumboTron scoreboard that would show animations after home runs.

column1: Grand Theft Auto (USA)>Grand Theft Auto>1999>ESRB - M (Mature)>Rockstar Games>DMA Design>Action>3.6>1 Player>"In Grand Theft Auto
column2: the player takes the role of a small-time criminal trying to make it big with the mob. Stealing cars
column3: doing jobs for the gangsters and behaving generally anti-social are the way to success.****The action moves through six levels spread over three different cities
column4: each based on a real US city: Liberty City (based on New York City)
column5: San Andreas (based on San Francisco) and Vice City (based on Miami). To finish a level
column6: a certain score must be reached. Stealing cars and crashing into traffic
column7: driving over pedestrians and killing cops all raise the score
column8: but the **big points are made through jobs. Answering phones or entering special cars brings mission assignments
column9: from simple ""ditch-a-hot-car"" jobs to supporting bank robberies or carrying out assassinations. Completing a mission will raise the score substantially and also increase the score multiplier
column10: so that completing the next felony will gain even more points.****Criminal behavior comes with a price of course: if policemen witness a crime
column11: the player's wanted level rises. At the lowest level
column12: a single police car might give chase
column13: whereas at the highest level whole car squads hunt the player
column14: the police set up roadblocks and shoot to kill. The only way to evade the cops is to find a respray shop and get a new paint job with new license plates. This costs money which is deducted from the score
column15: however. But even dying or being arrested are not the end. The player has several lives
column16: and ending up in jail simply results in being stripped of all weapons and armor and the score multiplier being lowered.****The entire action is viewed from a top-down perspective
column17: which zooms out while driving a car
column18: for a better overview at high speeds. The cities are many screens large and can be freely explored. Crates are scattered over the cities
column19: which might include weapons (from pistols to rocket launchers)
column20: armor or other bonus items: extra lives
column21: police bribes (used to reduce the wanted level to zero) and get-out-of-jail-free cards (used to retain score multiplier and weapons when busted). Dozens of different vehicles are available for the taking
column22: each with unique characteristics: a bus will handle very differently than a sports car."

column1: Hugo 5 - The Evil Mirror (Europe) (En
column2: Da
column3: Pl)>Hugo 5 - The Evil Mirror>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>ITE Media>ITE Media>Platform>2.7>1 Player>Having just barely survived his previous quest in Black Diamond Fever
column4: Hugo the Troll is back in yet another exciting adventure! Somewhere in the Tricky Troll forest the evil witch Scylla and her loyal companion Don Croco is trying to figure out a way to capture Hugolina and ruin the Hugo family. By accident Don Croco drops a tray containing some glasses and when Scylla looks at the broken glass she smiles - she has come up with the perfect evil plan…. The Evil Mirror Scylla surprises the Hugo family in their hut and hit Hugo on the head with a mirror.The mirror does not break but Hugo has been caught in the mirror by an evil spell! Scylla crushes the mirror and scatters the three mirror pieces throughout the Tricky Troll forest. Hugo has been captured and the only way to save him and to free Hugolina is to find the three mirror pieces.

column1: Killing Zone (USA)>Killing Zone>1996>ESRB - T (Teen)>Acclaim>Scarab>Fighter>1.7>1-2 Players>"Seven infamous monsters from Frankenstein to the Minotaur go head to head in this early PlayStation fighting game.****These initial seven monsters are all there is; there are no hidden characters to unlock or a final boss to beat.****Most of the characters are slow and un-manoeuvrable. This may be by design to represent the weight of the monsters; most of them are big and their fighting styles could be considered anything but skill based. For instance the Skeleton can jump on the opponent and stab them in the neck repeatedly with its sword while the Minotaur gores them with its horns. It must be said that the attacks in the game generally fit their respective monster.****There are only two game modes available with the main one being the standard ""Normal Mode"" where one player goes up against the six other monsters and finally a mirror match.  A second player can join in at any point (in fact it's the only way a second player can play as there is no Vs mode). If one completes this mode they are presented with a breakdown of their performance in each fight
column2: though no ending in the real sense
column3: as the game has no story at tall to explain why these monsters are fighting each other.****The second game mode is an innovative mode the game calls ""Auto Mode"" and devotes most of its manual to. In this mode the player functions as a side line trainer to train and guide an AI controlled monster (selectable from one of the same seven as the Normal Mode) through several tournaments. This is done by pressing various buttons on the controller to tell your monster to try to perform certain offensive or defensive plays.****The monster you are training start's of with little more than the ability to throw a punch and is slow to respond to your prompts
column4: but will gain additional attacks and respond quicker and more intelligently to your prompts the more it fights
column5: until it ultimately gains the full range of attacks it would have in the Normal Mode.****However the full potential of this mode is undermined by the games lack of any save feature."

column1: Konami Arcade Classics (USA)>Konami Arcade Classics>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Konami>KCE Sapporo>Miscellaneous>3.9>1-2 Players>Ten of Konami's classic arcade games
column2: originally released from 1981-1985
column3: make their their Playstation debut in this compilation:****Pooyan - As your fellow pigs lower and raise you in an elevator for the perfect shot
column4: you must defend them against the wolves.  Shoot their balloons with arrows or make a bunch of them lose their grip by hitting them with meat.  Time too many shots poorly and the wolves will inch their way up the tree towards you and the other pigs.  The higher they get
column5: the higher of an area you're restricted to for aiming.****Circus Charlie - Six games of timing
column6: reflex and patience in one
column7: each more difficult than the last.  Jump a lion through hoops and over flaming urns.  Hurdle over monkeys on a tight rope.  Bounce from trampoline to trampoline.  Roll and leap from ball to ball.  Avoid being knocked off your horse by jumping over or bouncing off of springboards.  And at the most challenging level
column8: fly from trapeze to trapeze.****Shao-Lin's Road - Leap from level to level
column9: kicking henchmen and their tougher bosses.  Collect powerups like the roatating energy ball and the spiked ball.****Roc 'N Rope - Cavemen and lizards impede your climb to reach the elusive Phoenix.  Your only tools are a rope and flashlight.  Throw your rope
column10: climb up
column11: and avoid your enemies or blind them with your flashlight.****Yie Ar Kung-Fu - One of the granddaddies of one-on-one fighters.  Start with the giant Buchu
column12: working your way up through the ranks against armed opponents using only your punches and kicks.  Each angle combined with either punch or kick provides a different attack.****Scramble - Fly your rocket through enemy territory
column13: avoiding enemy missiles or taking them down with your blasters or bombs.  If you run out of fuel
column14: you're history
column15: so remember to shoot the fuel tanks to refuel.****Road Fighter - A high-speed top-down racer.  Pass other racers to increase your score.  Crashing results in fuel penalties.  Run into the multi-colored fuel cars or run the risk of running out of gas.****Super Cobra - The speedy sequel to Scramble.  Pilot your helicopter through similar territory
column16: once again taking out rockets and fuel tanks.  But now
column17: you'll have to contend with turrets and other new enemies.****Gyruss - Wave-based shmup in which you move your ship around the screen in a 360 degree loop.  Avoid the swooping enemies and their shots.  Grabbing the double shot increases your chances of survival.****Time Pilot  Pilot your craft in every direction through borderless levels spread across time.  Biplanes
column18: blimps
column19: and more will try to take you out before you can eliminate them.  Catch parachuters for bonus points.****Each game
column20: originally mated with a vertical monitor in the arcade
column21: has been shrunk to fit the horizontal display common to most homes.  Accomodating for the smaller playfield size
column22: scores
column23: lives and power meters for most games have been moved to the previously empty space on the righthand side.****Added features include the following:****Saving - Retain all of your high scores.****Difficulty and Life Counts - Adjust them to your liking.****DualShock Compatibility - Use the analog stick and/or add vibration feedback to games.****Histories - Simple history pages featuring release dates
column24: screenshots and trivia.****Pre-game Instructions and Tips - Don't know how to play?  As the game loads
column25: you are presented with a simple instruction set
column26: similar to what would have been on the original machine.  Hit left or right at that screen for more detailed gameplay tips.

column1: Konami Open Golf (Europe)>Konami Open Golf>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Konami>Konami>Sports/Golf>3.5>1-4 Players>You are out on the course; the dew is beginning to disappear just as you step-up to the first tee. Line up the shot and blast your drive 350 yards down the center of the fairway. All of the excitement and drama of golf comes to the PlayStation with Konami Open Golf. You can choose from six different golfers
column2: each with different attributes and skills. Once you’ve chosen your golfer
column3: test their skills on a course designed with 32-bit polygon and texture-mapping technology. Compete against other players in a Tournament or Skins Game. For those who don’t want competition
column4: hit the course and practice your favorite shots. No matter how you play
column5: excellent play-by-play commentary brings the action to life. All of the realism and action in Konami Open Golf will make you think you’re out on the course.

column2: each with their own unique bike and riding style
column3: in a crazy race where anything goes. Use wacky power-ups against the opposition over single races or in the story mode. Alternatively
column4: take on a friend in a two-player head to head battle for the finish line. * Multiple game modes to choose from including story mode and 2-player split screen * 3 challenging difficulty settings * 8 wacky characters and bikes to master * 4 hidden boss characters to discover and defeat * 6 distinctive courses to ride on
column5: plus a bonus hidden track * Equip your character with a variety of weapons and power-ups
column6: from Nitros to Bazookas

column1: Krazy Ivan (USA)>Krazy Ivan>1996>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Psygnosis>Psygnosis>Shooter>2.5>1-2 Players>"In the early 21st century
column2: the Earth is under attack by aliens. In five areas of the planet
column3: they have erected energy generators
column4: creating a field that slowly encompasses the entire planet surface. They have also taken hundreds of humans prisoner. Someone has to stop them. Enter Russian Commander Ivan Popovich
column5: nicknamed ""Krazy Ivan"". He is a paranoid schizophrenic
column6: prone to burst out into violence at any time. In other words
column7: he's perfect for the job.****The player controls Ivan's ""Steel Cossack"" power suit on the three-dimensional battlefields. In each of the five areas in the game
column8: two kinds of enemies can be found: Drones and Sentients. Drones are smaller air and ground vehicles that often respawn. Sentients are mechs similar in size and capability to the Steel Cossack. Each of the Sentients must be eliminated before the energy field generator can be destroyed to complete the mission.****The Cossack is capable of carrying lots of weapons: projectile and energy guns
column9: unguided and guided missiles
column10: and other special weapons. Destroyed enemies reveal captured humans
column11: to be rescued by Ivan
column12: and power-ups
column13: which recharge shields or rearm weapons.****After a successful mission
column14: Ivan can upgrade the Cossack with more powerful weapons and replace the mech's armor.****Between the missions
column15: rather humorous live-action cutscenes (starring English actors sporting thick Russian accents) continue the story."

column1: Kurt Warner's Arena Football Unleashed (USA)>Kurt Warner's Arena Football Unleashed>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Midway>Midway>Sports/Football>2.9>1-2 Players>Kurt Warner's Arena League Unleashed is a modified version of NFL Blitz set in the Arena Football League.  Arena ball is a version of American football played indoors on a 50 yard field with nets behind each endzone and boards on the sidelines.****KWALU is a six on six game (real arena ball is eight on eight) with no penalties so post tackle stomping and dog piles are encouraged.  All 16 teams from the 1999 season are represented including Kurt's former team
column2: the Iowa Barnstormers.

column8: Ducky

Mo has his/her/its own game when the Big Water is reached and Peitrie has a picture puzzle game using pictures that are unlocked as the player progresses through the game collecting tree stars. column2: Inc.>Adventure>4.1>1 Player>"1500 years after Blood Omen: Legacy of Kain
column3: the vampire Kain's decision at the end of that game has finally defeated the human kingdoms and brought the world of Nosgoth under his control. Ruling from a castle built on the Pillars of Nosgoth
column4: Kain has established an empire of six vampire clans
column5: each ruled by a lieutenant
column6: the sons of Kain. Raziel was one such lieutenant
column7: but lost his position through the ""insolence"" of receiving a new evolutionary ""dark gift""
column8: the growth of feathery wings
column9: before his master had acquired it. Fearing that Raziel might one day surpass him
column10: Kain tears off Raziel's wings in a fit of range and banishes him into the Abyss.  There
column11: Raziel is lost in time
column12: died and his body consumed. The Elder God recovers Raziel's soul and rebuilds the broken body
column13: not as a living vampire
column14: but as a strange new creature of the underworld. Swearing revenge on Kain
column15: Raziel now phases seamlessly between Nosgoth and it's underworld
column16: using his new powers to become a terrible reaver of souls...****Soul Reaver is a 3rd person action-adventure title that follows Raziel on his quest to purge the land of vampires and take revenge on Kain and his brothers
column17: leaders of the six clans. The player controls the game from behind Raziel's shoulder
column18: moving him in any direction
column19: climbing
column20: attacking
column21: jumping and using specific abilities. Raziel's can grip onto the edge of ledges and his torn wings allow him to glide gently downwards. Raziel can shift through the ""material"" world into the ""spectral"" realm at will... but must find specific locations in order to shift back. The two realms mirror one another
column22: with distortions which give access to new areas and platforms. Existing in the material world drains Raziel's life energy at a constant rate.  Throughout the game
column23: energy is recovered by consuming the souls of defeated enemies. If Raziel is able to defeat one of his brothers
column24: he will additionally gain a new ability (""dark gift"") upon drinking it's soul. Examples include: the ability to swim
column25: file telekinetic projectiles or the ability to phase through locked gates. Raziel can arm himself with a variety of weapons including spears
column26: daggers
column27: swords
column29: as well as attacking enemies barehanded. Eventually
column30: Raziel will also come across Kain's personal sword (named the Soul Reaver)
column31: and will use it to create a powerful energy blade weapon.****The world is left open to Raziel
column32: he can return to areas previously completed and explore the world of Nosgoth at will. Access to certain areas however sometimes  requires the use of gained specific abilities. Many of the puzzles the player will need to solve in this quest are ""block puzzles""
column33: requiring the placement of certain large structures (usually square blocks)
column34: either to activate switches or to build access to out-of-reach areas."

column1: M&M's - Shell Shocked (USA)>M&M's - Shell Shocked>2001>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Simon & Schuster>Boston Animation>Action>2.6>1 Player>In M&M's - Shell Shocked
column2: the 2 lead candies are about to set off on a vacation until the red candy realizes that the yellow candy left the M&Ms Minis in charge of the candy factory. The Minis promptly steal the secret M&Ms formulas and cause havoc at the factory. It is up to the yellow candy to set the situation right.  The gameplay has been described as being similar to the Crash Bandicoot series. The action in the game takes place over 8 levels. The first 7 levels involve some kind of math skill (configurable at various skill levels to cover addition
column3: subtraction
column4: multiplication
column5: and division). The first level depicts the yellow candy frantically driving back to the candy factory. Along the way are math formulas on the side of the road
column6: followed closely by 3 crates on the road
column7: each with a number. Striking the crate with the correct answer for the previous formula will allow passage
column8: while the 2 wrong answers are steel crates that will end your vehicle. The same action is repeated in a later level involving a forklift.  Another type of level has the yellow candy jumping from number platform to number platform according to the math formulas that a disembodied female voice calls out. Another type of level is a 3D running/jumping action level in which the yellow candy will run down a hallway while observing clues about math formulas along the way. At the end of the hallway will be 3 doors
column9: each with a possible answer. Choose wisely.  All along the way are M&Ms candies to be collected in large quantities. Every 100 M&Ms candies earns the player an extra life.  The PlayStation version is basically the same game but minus the Math mode.

column3: who is a scientist. She has to save the world from bad DNA that is slowly ""eating"" everything away.  As a player
column4: you control this hovercraft-thingy which was designed to be a safe vehicle to be in while travelling through this infested world. The game has nice 3D graphics and a very unique mood to it that separates it from the more common shooters. "

column1: Machine Hunter (USA)>Machine Hunter>1997>ESRB - T (Teen)>MGM Interactive>Eurocom Developments Inc>Shooter>3.2>1-2 Players>A classic shooter with a twist. Aliens have invaded the Martian Colonies and reprogrammed the mining robots into killers. Earth
column2: fearing an invasion

The trick is learning to control 9 different types of robots to fight the other robots. There are many different worlds to explore as you locate and battle the robots. All of the worlds let you teleport to different locations on the planets.

column1: Magical Tetris Challenge (Europe)>Magical Tetris Challenge>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SCEE>Capcom>Puzzle>3.7>1-2 Players>Magical Tetris Challenge is a Tetris game that combines the classic puzzler with the Disney license
column2: and offers two original competitive Tetris variants: Magical Tetris and Updown Tetris.  Both follow the standard Tetris template: Tetris pieces fall onto the playing field from the top and must be arranged so they form horizontal lines which are then removed
column3: with the player whose stack of pieces reaches the top first losing.  In Magical Tetris
column4: clearing two or more lines at the same time sends a magical attack to the opponent
column5: which puts a non-standard magical piece into their queue. Magical pieces consists of more than four blocks and are thus harder to place
column6: but can theoretically clear more lines at once. Magical attacks can be countered by clearing lines while the piece is in the queue. This sends the piece back to the opponent
column7: changing it to a 2x2 square piece. Countered pieces can again be countered
column8: growing in size with each counter to a maximum of 5x5. Overflow to an already full queue turns existing pieces into ones marked with an exclamation mark. These can't be countered and are massive in size and come in pyramid or diamond shapes. A clock counts the time during Magical Tetris - each minute of game time raises the game level
column9: up to a maximum of 4
column10: with higher levels resulting in more magical pieces added to the opponent's queue per cleared line.  Updown Tetris is less complex. Attacks against the opponent are made by clearing two or more lines
column11: which are then (minus one column) added to the bottom of the opponent's playing field
column12: pushing their stack higher.  Both modes include another gameplay element: the magical gauge is filled by clearing single lines or through attacks made by the opponent. Filling the meter clears the entire playing field above a certain threshold and simplifies the block structure below it. The meter is then cleared and the threshold rises
column13: requiring more moves to fill it a second time. The threshold can only be lowered by clearing all blocks off the field.  The two modes are available in story and two-player modes. In story mode
column14: players select one of four Disney characters (Mickey
column15: Donald
column16: Goofy and Minnie) who each come with their own storylines. The game then consists of consecutive matches against the other characters and the bad guys (Pete
column17: Big Bad Wolf and Weasel)
column18: with cutscenes between matches.  Only the home versions have an endless mode
column19: which offers standard Tetris and Magical Tetris.

column1: Marble Master (USA)>Marble Master>2002>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Conspiracy Entertainment>Software 2000>Puzzle>2.8>1-2 Players>"Swing is a Tetris inspired puzzle game:**At the top of the screen you see two lines of eight balls (""spheres"") in different colors and weights (shown as numbers). At the bottom are four scales. **You can transport and put down one sphere at the same time through a grey device between the two parts described above. Three spheres of the same color side by side will disappear and give you points; all other same spheres in vertical or horizontal neighborhood to this three will also vanish (combos)!**The clue are the scales because of imbalance they go up or down and can catapult the spheres over the whole area! And there can be highest only eight spheres on one scale pan - otherwise game over. Later in a game there will be more and more colors and special items.**The multiplayer mode is even more funny because there you have to make big combos for better items which you can catapult into your opponents area!"

Martian Gothic - Unification (USA)>Martian Gothic - Unification>2001>ESRB - M (Mature)>Take-Two Interactive>Creative Reality>Adventure>2.7>1 Player>"It's the year 2017. The planet Earth sets up a research station

column1: Marvel Super Heroes (USA)>Marvel Super Heroes>1997>ESRB - T (Teen)>Capcom>Capcom>Fighter>3.1>1-2 Players>Marvel Super Heroes is a 2D fighting game and the second Capcom title to feature characters from the Marvel comic universe. The gameplay is very similar to X-Men: Children of the Atom

column1: Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter (USA)>Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Capcom>Capcom>Fighter>3.4>1-2 Players>Marvel Super Heroes Vs. It is also the first in Capcom's games to introduce a tag team style of combat where the player can call for another character during a fight.****Matches consists of two-on-two battles where the player can only control one character at a time. The other character can be called in regularly or while doing an attack. The off-screen one also regains some health while waiting. Both opposing characters need to be defeated to win the match

column1: Monster Rancher Hop-A-Bout (USA)>Monster Rancher Hop-A-Bout>2000>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Tecmo>Tecmo>Platform>4.5>1-2 Players>Monster Rancher Hop-A-Bout is a platform adventure game based on characters from the Monster Rancher video games and animated TV series. Hop-A-Bout is an addictive and easy-to-learn title that challenges players to hop their way through more than a hundred obstacle courses.****Designed to be 'fun for the whole family'
column2: Hop-A-Bout features arcade-style gameplay that is easy to learn and difficult to master.****Hop-A-Bout players can choose from a cast of colorful Monster Rancher**characters to start their journey. Armed with the ability to bounce slow or**fast and to the right or left
column3: characters must move from one end of a**playing course to the other
column4: avoiding dangerous obstacles and holes along**the way. Hopping onto various panels in each course helps or hinders** progress
column5: depending on the panel (a heart panel increases life
column6: **while a skull decreases life).****Additional features of Monster Rancher Hop-A-Bout include one and two-player modes and a stage edit function that allows players to create up to four customized courses that can be saved.

column1: MonsterSeed (USA)>MonsterSeed>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SunSoft>NK System>Strategy>2.2>1-2 Players>Not much of a fighter? Like to work with exotic animals? Like helping people? Then start gathering your seeds today!****Monster Seed obviously takes influence from the popular animal raising/fighting genre; specifically games like Pokémon and Monster Rancher. Of course
column2: it does do a few things differently. One major difference is the fantasy setting. No ranches or medical settings here
column3: no sir. Another key difference is in the overall presentation; Monster Seed's gameplay and interface are a lot more simple than most other breeding games.****Similar to mother games in the genre
column4: there's a brief tutorial of sorts
column5: and then you're off to gather your own creatures
column6: earning better seeds and other breeding components as you go. Just be careful with your critters
column7: because if they die in battle
column8: they're gone for good. Granted you can always breed more
column9: but it can certainly set you back if your creature hatches at level five
column10: but you lost a level twelve.****Combat itself uses a somewhat typical turn-based system
column11: with a grid used to determine character locations
column12: spell ranges and so on. Much like a normal RPG
column13: you get to take turns giving commands to your main character and your monsters. Different monsters are better suited for different roles
column14: with some better off hanging out in the back
column15: attacking from a distance and others in the front lines
column16: absorbing the damage and dishing out the hurt.****Monster Seed isn't the most innovative RPG/breeding game out there
column17: but it is a decent game that will help any fan of the genre pass the time.

column1: Mortal Kombat Mythologies - Sub-Zero (USA)>Mortal Kombat Mythologies - Sub-Zero>1997>ESRB - M (Mature)>Midway>Avalanche Software>Beat-'Em-Up>4.3>1 Player>In a surprising twist of fate

column3: and chronicles a series of events that ocurred prior to Mortal Kombat 1.****In a storyline that is reminiscent of Looking Glass's Thief
column4: the Lin Kuei assassin/thief is sent to steal an important document; this mission proves to be a test from a mysterious character (which turns out to be MK4's Quan Chi) and who charges you upon retrieval of this object to recover an ancient medallion of untold power. column5: Quan Chi reveals that he actually tricked you
column6: and the medallion is the key to awakening the demonic Shinnok (yup
column7: the same baddie from MK4). You must now become a reluctant hero

column9: where you must travel trough hazardous levels running and jumping around as well as fighting your way against both digitized and polygonal enemies. Sub-Zero's interface is the same as in every MK game

column12: which translates into new techniques and moves to execute in the game.****Technically speaking this game represents the final evolutionary step in the MK's series 2D engines. New features include zooming

column14: etc.

column1: One Piece Grand Battle! (Europe)>One Piece Grand Battle!>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari>Bandai>Fighter>3.5>1-2 Players>"Welcome to One Piece Mansion
column2: a place full of very different tenants that may or may not get along with one another. Your job is to help Polpo
column3: the landlord
column4: manage the mansion by keeping everyone as happy as possible
column5: collecting rent
column6: upgrading the mansion and fending off criminals.****In One Piece Mansion
column7: you will start off with a certain number of floors and a certain number of residents.  At the end of the month
column8: you will have to collect rent. You can build new rooms for tenants that wish to move in and by installing elevators
column9: you can build new floors and make the mansion expand. Just make sure you have enough money to make the upgrades/changes.****The residents can affect each other in either a positive or negative way
column10: depending on their own living habits. Some tenants will exert positive effects in the form of blue arrows into certain directions (up
column11: down
column12: left
column13: right and/or diagonally). By placing another tenant where these arrows are aiming at will help diminish their stress. At the same time
column14: some tenants will exert negative effects in the form of red arrows.  Tenants on the receiving end of these arrows will get stressed out. You can switch tenants around and make new rooms for them but it will cost you money. The key is to arrange the tenants in a certain way so that they all balance each other out harmoniously...otherwise they will leave without paying rent and the room will explode - forcing you to lose income and dish out to repair the damage. To prevent this from happening
column15: you will have to observe your tenants Stress Gauge that tells you their current stress level. ****Another factor to watch out for is Syndicate 5 - a group of criminals that moves in and disturbs your tenants.  When they do
column16: try to drive them out by placing tenants around them that will send them red arrows. Every now and then they may go out of their room and cause trouble. If that happens
column17: change to Security mode and move Polpo to where the criminal is. When he's there
column18: Polpo can blow his alarm whistle at the criminals which will send them scurrying back to their hide-out.****The game has two modes: Story and Endless.****In Story Mode
column19: Putica
column20: Polpo's little sister
column21: is kidnapped by Chocopape who is jealous of One Piece Mansion's success. To save Putica
column22: Polpa must complete 7 orders. These orders are goals that must be met before you can tackle the next stage. The goals include making a certain amount of income
column23: building a certain number of rooms or building a certain number of floors. Can Polpo handle all these challenges? Well it is up to you to make sure he does! ****The game is divided into stages and every now and then you will have to confront a ""Boss"". Just drive them out as you do the criminals.****In Endless Mode you can select from 3 difficulty settings: Easy
column24: Normal and Hard. There are no stages or ending
column25: you just try to run One Piece Mansion your own way and see how far you can go."

column1: Persona 2 - Eternal Punishment (USA)>Persona 2 - Eternal Punishment>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Atlus>Atlus>Role-Playing>4>1 Player>"In Eternal Punishment
column2: you play the role of Maya Amano

column4: together with a fortune-teller Ulala and a detective Katsuya. When they arrive at the school
column5: they find the principal murdered. A man appears - a man with a bag on his head
column6: who calls himself ""The Joker"". He says Maya and her friends will never defeat him unless they call upon their Personae - their other selves who can appear as mythical figures and help them in battles. The investigation continues

column1: Persona 2 - Tsumi (Japan - Translated)>Persona 2 - Tsumi>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Atlus>ITL>Role-Playing>4.1>1 Player>"A few years after the events described in Persona
column2: a curse has befallen Sumaru City
column3: a town in modern-day Japan. The curse is placed by a mysterious person who calls himself the Joker. Rumors say that he can fulfill people's wishes
column4: but also does something horrible to those who for some reason fail to express a wish. A group of high school students decides to investigate the matter. However
column5: when they confront the Joker
column6: he tells them that they have hurt him in the past
column7: and that he is out for revenge now. The young people realize that the Joker's appearance is just the beginning of a sinister chain of events
column8: and will have to look for answers within their own souls.  Persona 2: Innocent Sin is similar in structure and basic gameplay to its predecessor. Much of the game consists of navigating a party of up to five active combatants through locations in the large city
column9: exploring complex dungeons
column10: and fighting randomly appearing demons in round-based style. Unlike the first game
column11: dungeons are viewed from an angled overhead perspective with rotatable camera. Rather than having the option of using either a melee weapon or a gun

column13: communication with demons plays a significant role. The demon conversation system has been refined: it is now possible to choose more specific and accurate dialogue lines
column14: and the effects of the player's responses are less random. Tarot cards of a specific Persona type are collected from the demons following a successful conversation. They can be later used in a special location called Velvet Room to acquire new Personae
column15: which can be equipped on playable characters

column17: which allows the player to acquire and spread rumors through rumormongers inhabiting the city. Due to the curse placed on the city

column19: for example by spreading a rumor about powerful black market weapons."

column1: Phix - The Adventure (USA)>Phix - The Adventure>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Agetec>Affect>Action>2.7>1 Player>The Magnia Stone
column2: the sacred stone of the Magnetic World is knocked off its floating altar in the sky and falls towards a slumbering creature called Phix. He swallows it and starts to attract metallic objects and creatures. This upsets the balance of the world
column3: and evil creatures start to appear throughout the land. Phix must travel to five realms in order to bring the stone to its original place and return peace.****Phix: The Adventure is a 3D platform with a magnetic element similar to the earlier Super Magnetic Neo. The main character attracts or repels objects and enemies by switching polarity (between north and south with the ? button). Touching the enemy decreases the number of hearts at the left bottom of the screen. Falling on pits or water kills Phix instantaneously. The ? button shoots magnetic particles (enemies can be killed by particles of opposite polarity: north enemies are affected by south particles
column4: and vice-versa). Pressing and holding the ¦ activates a neutral field that lasts some seconds and shields Phix from the magnetic activity around him. The X button makes the character jump. To reach higher places
column5: Phix first must connect to magnetic spots on the ground by selecting the opposite polarity and then switch to the same polarity. Activating the neutral field at this exact moment makes him jump even higher.****The game has five worlds

When hit by an enemy the skunk loses one of his green orbs (which acts as hitpoints) and when all out of these a life is lost. More orbs can be earned by taking out enemies. Collectable stars can be found all around the levels and by getting a hundred of these an extra life is earned.  The player will come across various extreme gears that allow him to progress through the levels. Once a gear is equipped the regular spray attack can not be used. There are six gears but only one can be equipped at a time. These include the diggers which allow the player to dig through earth in a Dig-Dug fashion
column3: the paraglider which allows him to use air currents to his advantage
column4: the pogo stick that allows him to jump higher
column5: the skates which allows him to move really fast and the snowboard which allows him to gain speed on downhill slopes. There is also a jetpack that is only available towards the end of the game.

column1: Putter Golf (USA)>Putter Golf>2001>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Agetec>Amedio>Sports/Golf>2.2>1-4 Players>"Putter Golf is a 3D miniature golf simulation. It features both a ""normal"" 9-hole course
column2: with realistic courses
column3: as well as a ""trick"" 9-hole course
column4: with somewhat more unusual features
column5: such as warp zones and conveyor belts. Rounding out the package is a mix mode
column6: with randomly selected holes from both courses
column7: and a practice mode that both allows you to practice hitting on various slopes
column8: and try out the features from the trick mode.****You can compete both against the CPU
column9: on multiple difficulty levels
column10: and against up to three other players."

column1: Puzzle Star Sweep (USA)>Puzzle Star Sweep>2001>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Agetec>Axela>Puzzle>2.6>1-2 Players>"In this vaguely Tetris-like game
column2: players score points by eliminating ""star blocks.""  A star block is a colored rectangle with a star on one end of it
column3: and blocks are eliminated when the stars of two like-colored blocks touch each other.  While the game is being played
column4: star blocks and obstacles rise from the bottom of the screen while the player moves and rotates a cursor which determines where additional star blocks will be thrown into play from off-screen.  The game features single-player and competitive play as well as a story mode featuring boss creatures and a bizarre plot -- apparently the whole game is actually a sport in which children poke a creature known as a star pig with sticks in order to make it vomit star blocks."

column1: Puzznic (USA)>Puzznic>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Mud Duck Productions>Altron>Puzzle>2.4>1 Player>The challenge in each level of Puzznic is to maneuvre a selection of blocks into place so as to clear them all
column2: by making them make contact with blocks of the same design. You control a cross-hair
column3: which can move a block left or right
column4: which can cause it to fall if there is no block under the space it would occupy.****There are many complications in terms of solving the levels. Moving platforms meaning that you need to move a block at a particular time
column5: or in particular order
column6: to prevent them being blockaded. In some situations there are an odd number of a certain type of block - solving these requires positioning two of the blocks one space apart
column7: such that a move will result in a piece making contact with 2 others
column8: and immediately removing all 3. You will also encounter blocks positioned on platforms suspended in space and gaps in level arrangements meaning that a certain number of blocks must be in place to make a certain move possible (by forming a stack
column9: for example)****The game structure is slightly unusual
column10: as after you complete each batch of four levels you get a choice of 2 sets of levels - you are progressing through an expanding matrix of levels
column11: which means there are 2 sets on level 2
column12: 3 on level 3
column13: 4 on level 4
column14: and so on. This means that there are a total of 220 screens in the game. Each screen is played against a time limit
column15: and losing a level (either by running out of time
column16: or by making a poor move and leaving an impossible position) loses one of your 3 lives.

column1: Q-bert (USA)>Q-bert>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari>Digital Eclipse>Action>2.5>1-2 Players>The hip character from the 1980's returns in a new

column3: you must help Q*bert save his friends
column4: while solving all of the detailed 3D level that are part of 4 unique worlds
column5: while avoiding the bad guys at the same time. And that's no easy task. Powerups litter the levels
column6: while warp points can get you out of all those sticky situations.

column1: Qix Neo (USA)>Qix Neo>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Mud Duck Productions>Taito Corporation>Puzzle>3.5>1 Player>QIX Neo is a remake of Volfied
column2: Taito's arcade game from 1989. The graphics and sounds were upgraded
column3: but the basic gameplay remains the same
column4: with the player controlling a tiny ship moving over a green contour line. The thin line is drawn over the edges of the screen
column5: framing the game field. The ship acts as a cursor and has to be used to draw a square or rectangular extension into the field
column6: thus removing it and slowly decreasing the size of the available space. Enemies roam each level
column7: moving in random patterns around the screen but always following the movements of the cursor. The ship has a force-field shield around it
column8: and only becomes vulnerable when drawing new lines.****The player has to quickly close the sections
column9: timing it correctly to avoid collision with any of the foes or their projectiles. The enemies can be eliminated by connecting a section where they are standing
column10: or by using one of the power-ups. The power-ups are stored inside boxes
column11: that in some levels keep appearing and disappearing
column12: and can be collected by removing a section with one of them inside. Most of the powers are temporary
column13: giving lasers to destroy the smaller aliens
column14: freezing the enemies for a few seconds
column15: increasing the speed of the ship and helping in other ways. Each level is finished after removing at least 70% of the field
column16: or if the large boss monster that shoots at random intervals is killed in some way. A port of the original game is also included
column17: using the old assets but with a horizontal orientation.

column9: armor

column1: R-Types (USA)>R-Types>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>ASCII>Irem Software Engineering>Shooter>3.7>1-2 Players>R-Types is a compilation of R-Type and R-Type II ported pixel-for-pixel from the coin-op to the PlayStation.****A couple of handy features have been added to the games that help prevent them from being impossibly difficult. column1: R4 - Ridge Racer Type 4 (USA)>R4 - Ridge Racer Type 4>1999>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Namco>Namco>Driving>3.9>1-2 Players>"Developed exclusively for the Sony Playstation

column11: Pac Racing Team

column23: sponsors will be unwilling to invest in the team and instead of a new car

column8: each character must find a way to escape from the nightmare while solving the mystery of what happened to Raccoon City. Each character will gain the periodic assistance of a fellow survivor... Leon will team up with a mysterious but well armed woman calling herself Ada Wong

column1: Resident Evil 3 - Nemesis (USA)>Resident Evil 3 - Nemesis>1999>ESRB - M (Mature)>Capcom>Capcom Production Studio 4>Adventure>4.2>1 Player>"So Evil they even gave it a subtitle!****The final installment of the Resident Evil series for the Playstation
column2: Resident Evil 3 takes place during the events of Resident Evil 2. The midwestern town of Raccoon City is in ruins
column3: having been overrun with the undead creating T-virus thanks to the wacky hijinks of William Birkin and Umbrella Inc. As Jill ""master of unlocking"" Valentine (one of the two main protagonists of the original Resident Evil)
column4: you must find a way out of the zombie-infested remains of the city alive. Along the way
column5: you'll interact with and receive help from three heavily armed Umbrella mercenaries who have also become stranded in Raccoon City thanks to the incompetence of their employer. Standing in the way of your group's last escape are a horde of flesh-eating zombified citizens
column6: homicidal mutants
column7: and a relentless killing machine known only as Nemesis who is determined to hunt down and kill the survivors of the original Resident Evil
column8: including Jill.****A dramatic improvement over Tyrant/Mr. X/G from the previous games
column9: Nemesis possesses the same maneuverability as Jill allowing him to run (faster than you
column10: in fact)
column11: use firearms (such as a rocket launcher)
column12: dodge attacks
column13: and even move through doors and from room to room in pursuit of Jill. On top of that he still possesses the nigh indestructibility we've come to know and... well
column14: know from Umbrella's ultimate bio-weapons. ****Like its two predecessors Resident Evil 3 is a third-person action-adventure game with polygonal characters on pre-rendered backgrounds with cinematic camera angles
column15: a technique originally pioneered by Alone in the Dark. Although the game uses the same basic engine and gameplay as the previous games
column16: improvements include auto-targeting
column17: a 180 degree spin
column18: and a new dodge move that allows you to avoid enemy attacks by pressing a button a second before they strike. Another addition is Jill's ability to create different kinds of ammunition by mixing together three different types of gunpowder found throughout the game. Compared to Resident Evil 2
column19: the amount of available ammunition and healing items has been significantly decreased
column20: making the game more difficult. The variety of zombie citizens has also been made more diverse.****The number of polygons in the character models has also been increased
column21: along with the possible screen resolution and color depth for the PC version (up to 1600 X 1200 at 32 bits
column22: from a maximum of 640 X 480 at 16 bits for Resident Evil 2). Another welcome addition in the PC version is the ability to skip cutscenes as well as the door loading animation.****The PC and Dreamcast versions includes all eight of Jill's possible costumes

column1: Star Fighter (USA)>Star Fighter>1996>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Acclaim>Krisalis Software Ltd>Shooter>3.8>1 Player>"3037. FedNet is now in control of the federation

column1: Super Dropzone - Intergalactic Rescue Mission (Europe)>Super Dropzone - Intergalactic Rescue Mission>2003>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Ignition Entertainment>Ignition Entertainment>Shooter>2.5>1 Player>Super Dropzone: Intergalactic Rescue Mission is a sequel to Archer MacLean's Dropzone. They were attacked by an alien race that the player had to defend them from. Now they have managed to establish bases on three more of Jupiter's moons
column2: Callisto

The player controls a spaceman with a jetpack and can fly in all directions above the moon surface while killing wave after wave of aliens. At the same time the player has to protect the ten people that are assigned to the moon by taking them to the dropzone landing pad. The action takes place on the moons mentioned above as well as on Jupiter itself. At the last level on each moon the player has to defeat a planet guardian. To do this the player has to hit them in their glowing green nerve centre that is exposed at times as they move around. Each wave starts with all remaining humans being beamed up by a leader enemy and to release the men it has to be defeated.

column1: Super Football Champ (Europe)>Super Football Champ>1997>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Mindscape Inc.>Taito Corporation>Sports/Soccer>3.5>1-2 Players>Football Champ is an arcade-style football (soccer) video game. The game was produced by Team Dogyan developers in Japan
column2: and originally released in the arcades by Taito Corporation in 1990. Euro Football Champ and Hat Trick Hero are versions of this game with minor variations. Super Football Champ is the Playstation conversion of Taito's classic arcade machine of the year 1995. Super Football Champ is different. It is pure arcade action that deflates the idea that all video soccer games must be a serious simulation of the sport. SFC is the type of football game that you would spend your loose change on for an hour or so in the arcades before scoffing a packet of chips on the way home. The in-game graphics are typically arcade with bulky polygon players plodding around the pitch
column3: pushing and shoving for possession of the ball. Although they appear as a squad of numbered clones
column4: your star player does stand out from the crowd with his individual features and hair style (not forgetting to mention the flashing 'Ace' arrow over his head). The duration of the match may last from 2 - 18 minutes with the difficulty level ranging from easy to very hard when playing against the computer. The offside rule may be switched off for a more flowing game while extra time may include the sudden death rule for a definite outcome. There are 30 International teams to choose from with the skill set at the level of their real-life counterparts. Each player will perform to the positional strengths of their team - apart from the 'Ace'. Super Football Champ feature four modes of play. League allows to play 3 different kind of leagues. Exhibition is a single player game against the CPU
column5: a head to head against a mate or a cooperative partnership against the CPU. Worldwide Tournament begins with group matches before entering the quarter finals for a straight knockout. District Tournament is a straight KO competition

The multiplayer mode is even more funny because there you have to make big combos for better items which you can catapult into your opponents area!"

column1: Tecmo Super Bowl (USA)>Tecmo Super Bowl>1996>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Tecmo>Tecmo>Sports/Football>3.4>1-2 Players>The original Tecmo Bowl was an instant hit on the Nintendo Entertainment System. The game combined simple

column1: Unholy War
