column3: The>1998>ESRB - T (Teen)>Eidos>Toys for Bob>Strategy>3.8>1 Player>"Two powerful forces are about to clash and you must decide which side you are on. Each side is compromised of seven different types of warriors for a total of 14 playable warriors.  Each warrior has three separate types of moves or attacks that can be performed against their opponent.  Each warrior also has a strategy skill that can be used when playing that mode of gameplay.****There are two types of gameplay

column7: hurling their attacks and avoiding traps.****Strategy Mode consists of a three-dimensional map where the player moves his warriors across it with the ultimate goal to destroy the opposing warriors or destroy their fortresses.  When two warriors meet on the map

column10: attacking

column1: Vanguard Bandits (USA)>Vanguard Bandits>2000>ESRB - T (Teen)>Working Designs>Human Entertainment>Strategy>3.9>1 Player>Vanguard Bandits is a strategy/RPG that takes place on the continent of Eptina which has been at war with itself for years until the kingdom of Pharastia discovers ancient mechanical giants created by a lost civilization. With the new found mecha's called ATAC (All Terrain Armored Combatant) Pharastia once again brings peace to Eptina until civil wars and coup d' etat's took place and thus began the Second Eptina Wars. Take control of Bastion as he wages war against the Junaris Empire to regain control of the continent. ****Gameplay consists of controlling a group of ATAC on missions on a 2D sprite map where players take turns moving and attacking. Once a fight between two ATAC's starts the game is switched to a 3D side view and the battle between the two continues. Use the terrain to your advantage like attacking from above or behind your enemy. ****Follow the story of Bastion and his friends on 56 missions to regain peace on the continent. Your actions before battles and as the results of battles will decide your outcome - with 5 different endings along three separate story lines.

column6: Inc>Strategy>3.6>1 Player>X-COM: Terror from the Deep is the follow-up to the successful resource management and tactical combat game X-COM: Enemy Unknown.****It has been 40 years since X-COM last defeated the aliens. Now
column7: in the year of 2040
column8: aliens begin to appear on the Earth again. This time the threat to humanity is coming from the depths of oceans.****The game is almost identical to the original X-COM game. The user interface

column1: X-Com - UFO Defense (USA)>X-Com - UFO Defense>1995>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>MicroProse>MicroProse Software
column2: Inc>Strategy>2.9>1 Player>The UFOs are invading our skies! Reports of human and bovine abductions are increasing daily! Cities are terrorized! Something must be done!****XCOM
column3: or eXtraterrestrial COMbat unit
column4: was founded as an international force to combat the alien menace. Start with one base
column5: two fighters
column6: one transport
column7: and a few soldiers
column8: you must stop the alien threat... once and for all.****X-COM: UFO Defense is a strategy game featuring separate but interlinked elements. On the strategic side
column9: called GeoScape
column10: you get a rotating view of the globe
column11: where you see all visible UFOs (those that are within your detection range) as well as major cities and your base(s). You order movements from here
column12: such as sending out fighters to intercept UFOs
column13: transports with soldiers to assault/recover UFOs
column14: and perhaps assaults on alien bases (if you find any). You also control your research
column15: as you must invent better weapons (the Terran weapons are just no match against the alien weapons) quickly
column16: not to mention all the other cool tech you can recover from the aliens. You also need to control your budget
column17: as you can't afford to overextend your reach. Researchers need to be paid
column18: engineers (who build the new toys) need to be paid
column19: base(s) need to be be built/expanded
column20: planes need to be bought/maintained
column21: supplies need to be replenished... ****You can earn money by selling unneeded stuff
column22: and you receive funding from the nations of the world; however
column23: a nation can decrease its funding if it decides you aren't operating efficiently enough within its region. It's even possible that a nation gets so fed up with you that it signs a pact with the aliens and ceases funding altogether. ****Once you join a ground battle
column24: the game switches to Battlescape
column25: which is an isometric view of the battlefield with realistic line-of-sight calculations and turn-based combat. Your mission is usually extermination of all aliens on the battlefield
column26: though if you can capture a few it would surely help your research efforts. If you win
column27: you also recover any alien artifacts left on the field
column28: which can then be researched.****In combat
column29: each of your soldiers has a specific number of Time Units. Doing anything (moving
column30: shooting
column32: rearranging objects in the inventory etc.) costs a number of TUs. Once a soldier is out of TUs
column33: he cannot act any more this turn (he gets all his TUs back on the next turn
column34: though). ****The game aims to mix strategic considerations
column37: along with plenty of authentic UFO lore.

column10: filled up when the player performs moves. When it is maxed out an X-Ability or Hyper X special move can be performed. Other general features are the abilities to super jump
column11: roll away and aiming projectiles.

column1: X2 (Europe)>X2>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Ocean>Team 17>Shooter>3>1-2 Players>X2: No Relief is the sequel to Project-X for up to two players. Like its predecessor

column3: and they should simply get rid of the attacking aliens.****To do so
column4: the player has a choice between three types of space ship
column5: each of them differs in terms of firepower and speed. The game has two different difficulty modes and a password system to resume the fight for the first five levels. During gameplay
column6: the player has the possibility to pick up a wide variety of power-ups for their ship. Next to the main gun
column7: side weapons and anti-gravity orbs with their own firepower can be obtained as well as mega-bombs
column8: among other things.****The game is over once all lives or continues are used up. The player is then taken to a high-score screen to enter their initials.

column1: Xena - Warrior Princess (USA)>Xena - Warrior Princess>1999>ESRB - T (Teen)>Electronic Arts>Value Wave>Action>3.7>1-2 Players>"This is an action game based on the TV series of the same name. As Xena

column5: hacking
column6: kicking
column7: slashing
column8: and cutting everything that gets in your way. You can find and upgrade items as you proceed through the levels. Apart from a variety of moves

column1: Xenocracy (Europe)>Xenocracy>1998>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Grolier Interactive>Simis Ltd>Action>2.8>1 Player>"Xenocracy is a cross between a space combat action sim and a political strategy game with a unique premise.  In the far future
column2: four planetary superpowers (the Earth Dominion
column3: the Mercury League
column4: the Venus Alliance and the Mars Combine) are vying for control of the solar system and on the brink of all-out ""thermostellar war"".  As commander of the United Planet Nations peacekeeping fighter squadron
column5: your role is to maintain the balance and prevent cold war and localized conflicts from escalating into open interplanetary hostilities.  Further complicating the matter
column6: you must deal with pirates and a looming alien threat.****As each planetary superpower launches low-intensity strikes (as opposed to open warfare) against the colonies and outposts of the other three
column7: you are presented with the choice
column8: via a strategic solar system map showing flaring geopolitical hotspots
column9: of which to aid.  If you aid one superpower too much at the expense of the others
column10: as one is first tempted to do
column11: you upset the balance and cause the war you sought to prevent.  Whichever you choose
column12: afterward you are realistically presented with complaints and political propaganda from the other three superpowers
column13: and receive news broadcasts concerning the interplanetary geopolitical wrangling.****In addition to keeping the peace
column14: you also manage research and development of newer and more powerful technologies
column15: which will eventually prove crucial.  Several fighter and weapon types are available
column16: and the scenery varies from asteroid belts and dust clouds to planetary surfaces.  You may choose from several wingmen
column17: each with a personal description and personality type
column18: whom you must do your best to keep alive.  Missions include such tasks as defending mine complexes from attack (or attacking them) and protecting convoys (or destroying them).****Xenocracy also allows Arcade Mode
column19: in which you simply fly missions without regard to the strategic aspects of the game
column20: and multiplayer games of up to 8 players over TCP/IP or serial connections."

column1: Xenogears (USA) (Disc 1)>Xenogears  Disc 1>1998>ESRB - T (Teen)>Squaresoft>Squaresoft>Role-Playing>3.9>1 Player>"A war has been raging on the continent of Ignas between the Kislev Empire to the north and the kingdom of  Aveh in the south. It has gone for so long that people have forgotten the cause. As a mysterious organization called ""Ethos"" introduces an ancient technology in form of huge mega-robots
column2: the tides are turning. A new army called ""Gebler"" is pulling the strings and supports Aveh to regain its authority over Kislev. ****A failed attempt to steal one of Kislev's new Gears
column3: a giant robot named ""Weltall""
column4: leads to a fight between a group of Gebler and Kislev guards in the remote town of Lahan in the outskirts of Aveh. One of the villagers
column5: Fei Fong Wong
column6: impulsively takes possession of ""Weltall"" and steers it to fight. As Fei's best friend Timothy is killed during the battle
column7: he releases a massive wave of energy and destroys the whole village together with one of his close friends
column8: Alice.****After this tragedy
column9: Fei is blamed for the destruction of the village and the death of his friends. Pursued by military governments and mysterious forces Fei sets out on an epic quest for answers and his own forgotten past.****""Xenogears"" is a traditional Asian RPG with an important new feature. There are two types of combat in the game: standard and gear. In standard combat
column10: your characters fight with equipped weapons
column11: learning and performing different combos that can be executed in one turn. But often you'll have to explore dungeons while piloting giant robots called ""gears"". Gear combat follows different rules: you perform moves until you run out of fuel
column12: and must concentrate on finishing the enemy quickly. You can equip various accessories on your gears
column13: including those that will let you partially restore your fuel. Gears cannot level up
column14: but can be upgraded in workshops."

column3: De)>Yeh Yeh Tennis>2000>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SunSoft>SunSoft>Sports/Tennis>4>1-2 Players>Yeh Yeh Tennis is an all-new tennis simulation from Sunsoft. The way the game is structured allows players to create their own players from scratch choosing not only the physical attributes of the players and their characteristic styles of play but also their temperament. So for example you could choose a left-handed smash and volley player with a fierce backhand and a fiery temperament who excels on clay. Or a defensive back-line player with a mean forehand drive and an attitude that is as cool as a cucumber and who perhaps favours the more traditional grass surface. Once the individual qualities of your original player have been chosen then the job of steering this player through the modest local tournaments
column4: the more illustrious national tournaments and then the prestigious Grand slam events begins. The player must hone his or her skills using practice modes or match practice to gradually increase their world ranking until he or she is an established seeded player ready to take on the very best. The player has seven seasons in which to become the Grand Slam Champion and thereby the world number one. The tournament pattern itself is taken from the real life structure of competition so players can really immerse themselves in the competitive world of the Pro-Tennis and make this a thoroughly entertaining and absorbing experience.

column5: It)>Yetisports Deluxe>2004>ESRB - E (Everyone)>JoWooD Entertainment AG>Edelweiss Medienwerkst>Party>2>1 Player>Yetisports Deluxe is collection of two mini games based on the Yetisports browser games:•Super Pingo Throw: Based on Yetisports Part 1: Pingu Throw. The player takes the part of a polar bear with a baseball bat. A penguin falls from a mountain and the player has to hit him with a timed mouse click. The goal is to time this perfectly so the penguin flies a long range. In comparison to the browser game this version adds additional obstacles which stop the penguin
column6: wales which give a speed boost when the penguin lands on it and wind. There is also an additional playing mode where the player has to strike other ice bears which are standing on the runway.  •Orca Slap: Based on Yetisports Part 2: Orca Slap. Here the player stands in front of a big dart board. Then penguins fly into the screen (on at a time) and the player has to throw a snowball at them. The the penguin gets deflected and flies to the dart board and the player scores. The goal is to get a high score. In comparison to the browser game this version adds a slot machine between rounds where the player can get additional penguins or snowballs. There is also an additional playing mode where the player has to hit specific fields on the dart board. Both games feature improved graphics and a multiplayer mode.

column5: It)>Yetisports World Tour>2004>ESRB - E (Everyone)>JoWooD Entertainment AG>Edelweiss Medienwerkstatt>Sports>3.6>1-4 Players>"Yetisports World Tour is the second game in the Yetisports games series for the Playstation One console. The first one was Yetisports Deluxe. Yetisports (also known as Pingu Throw) is a web-based Flash game that originally appeared on the Internet in January 2004. The goal of the original game is to have a yeti smack a penguin with a club and try to get it fly as far as possible. The original Yetisports game features no name other than the words ""1978 Reinhold + Yeti""
column6: a reference to Reinhold Messner's claim to have found Yetis. The game is humorous and addictive at the same time and therefore very popular on the Internet. Very soon after release
column7: there was a quick succession of many variants created by multiple people on the internet. None of these are officially sponsored by Chris Hilgert
column8: even though many copy the original almost exactly save certain small changes. One of the more violent variants was made by someone known as 'Pawel'
column9: featuring decapitation
column10: spikes
column11: a big spiky club and mines. Since the original was released at the Yetisports homepage
column12: the website has released nine further adventures of the Yeti as well as a re-release of the original that allows movement of the penguin in flight. A further set of PlayStation exclusive games followed
column13: released as ""YetiSports World Tour"" which is one of the very last titles to be released on the console As most retail outlets no longer supporting the PS1 from 2005 it struggled to find shops willing to stock it. The game features 10 new mini games (that wasn't released before) and they can be played by one player or up to 4 players in multiplayer mode. After Antarctic and Australia (""Pingu Throw""
column14: ""Orca Slap""

column16: Africa will be the next continent where the famous Yeti and his peguins will arrive today. ""Underneath giraffes
column17: over elephants and acacias
column18: catapulted high up to the sky by snakes and carried by vultures
column19: the penguin demonstrates clean flying tricks on advanced level. With the help of Nile-flamingos
column20: Yeti undertakes the probably most amusing safari in the African savanna in the fifth part of the cult-series"". Some of the game games are: Pingu Throw
column21: Orca Slap
column22: Seal Bounce
column23: Albatross Overload & Flamingo Drive. "

column2: Inc>Puzzle>3.4>1-2 Players>YoYo's Puzzle Park is a puzzle platform game for the PlayStation.****At the opening ceremony of the Gussan Paradise theme park
column3: a creature known as YoYo invades it. He takes hostages from the crowd and manages to elude the police and take control of the park. It's up to Guss and Yodie
column4: two innocent bystanders
column5: to take back the park.****The game features some sixty platform filled levels similar to Bubble Bobble. The player (as Guss or Yodie) can hop around on them
column6: while avoiding the enemies that crowd the platforms. The enemies hurt the player by touching them
column7: and some have ranged attacks like lasers. The players can strike back at the enemies with bombs that scatter the level
column8: throwing or jumping on them activates their two second fuse. The goal is to kill all the enemies in a level within the time limit.****To aid the protagonists there are several collectibles such as vehicles. Guss and Yodie can also stun enemies with their Yo-yos.****In the multi-player mode
column9: you can fight against your friends in a two player deathmatch game.

column4: and lineage. Each character represents either a good or an evil alignment and depending on the character chosen

column6: punching and kicking are on three separate buttons. There are variations of each of these moves depending on how quick the button is pressed.  Consistently damaging or taking damage from an opponent will add to a sol or lunar (depending on the character the player is playing as) power gauge. When this gauge is filled

column1: Z (Europe)>Z>1997>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>GT Interactive>The Bitmap Brothers>Strategy>3.9>1 Player>"Z is a real-time strategy game in which you fight for control of the sectors
column2: some of which contains manufactories that can gain you additional units. Touch the ""flag"" in the sector and it's yours. Capture the sector before the new unit comes out of the manufactory and the new unit is yours. With six different robots (different armaments
column3: armor
column4: and speed)
column5: multiple vehicles (from jeeps to tanks) the robots can utilize
column6: your ultimate objective is to destroy the opponent's base
column7: and prevent him from doing the same to you.  The game differs from many other RTSs by emphasizing territorial control (and the manufactories) instead of getting kills and gathering a big army. You have to finely balance defense and offense. If you wait too long
column8: the enemy will grab all the manufactories first. If you go too fast
column9: you'll get hammered for stretching yourself too thin. You can hijack enemy vehicles by shooting the driver off. If you send a group of soldiers toward an objective and they find a vehicle
column10: one of them will split off to grab the vehicle; you don't really need to micromanage each soldier. "

column1: Zero Divide (USA)>Zero Divide>1995>ESRB - T (Teen)>Time Warner Interactive>Zoom Inc>Fighter>3.1>1-2 Players>Zero Divide is a 3D robot fighting game. You play one of eight robotic fighters and must battle your way through multiple levels in single player

column1: Zero Divide 2 - The Secret Wish (Europe)>Zero Divide 2 - The Secret Wish>1998>ESRB - E (Everyone)>SCEE>Zoom Inc>Beat-'Em-Up>3.4>1-2 Players>XTAL has been defeated and the hackers responsible rounded up. However
column2: the leader of the hackers reveals that the group have also unleashed a second artificial intelligence into the data library
column3: known as EVE. The player must take control of one of EVE's attack programs and use them to destroy the other guard programs and then EVE herself.****The first sequel to the early Play Station fighter  Zero Divide features all new higher resolution graphics and higher poly models than the original game.****It adds two new robots
column4: the nurse like Pixel and the crab like Cancer along with a few new bosses and hidden characters.****It adds a variety of different shaped and new arena types (the original game only had standard square arenas) from completely walled in ones to ones with low barriers that the opponent can be juggled over to lead to a ring out.****Rounds are now considerably shorter and the robot's armour easier to knock off. But on the whole
column5: it really does play pretty much the same as the original game.
